title: Field-adapted PPRV whole genome MinION library build
title_html: Field-adapted PPRV whole genome MinION library build
article_citation: Torsson E, Kgotlele T, Misinzo G, Wensman JJ, Berg M, Lindsjö OK, Field-Adapted Full Genome Sequencing of Peste-Des-Petits-Ruminants Virus Using Nanopore Sequencing. Frontiers in Veterinary Science doi: 10.3389/fvets.2020.542724

authors.name: Emeli Torsson
authors.affiliation: Swedish University of Agricultural Sciences, Department of Biomedical Sciences and Veterinary Public Health

authors.name: Oskar Karlsson Lindsjö
authors.affiliation: Swedish University of Agricultural Sciences, Department of Molecular Sciences

source.description:
Set up the following reaction
AB
1Random hexamers (50 ng/µl)1 µl
2dNTP mix (10 mM)1 µl 
3RNA1 - 11 µl
4DEPCto reach 13 µl
5Total 13 µl
Mix and centrifuge, then heat to anneal primers

AB
1Random hexamers (50 ng/µl)1 µl
2dNTP mix (10 mM)1 µl 
3RNA1 - 11 µl
4DEPCto reach 13 µl
5Total 13 µl

For each sample, set up the following end-repair /dA-tailing reaction
AB
1Ultra II End Prep Reaction Buffer 3.5 μl
2Ultra II End Prep Enzyme Mix 1.5 μl
3DNA from previus step25 μl
4Total 30 μl
Gently mix reaction by pipetting up and down at least 10 times, then quickly centrifuge to collect all liquid.

AB
1Ultra II End Prep Reaction Buffer 3.5 μl
2Ultra II End Prep Enzyme Mix 1.5 μl
3DNA from previus step25 μl
4Total 30 μl

In thermocycler (heated lid at >75 °C) sett up the following protocol
AB
120 °C5 minutes
265 °C (inactivate enzyme)5 minutes

AB
120 °C5 minutes
265 °C (inactivate enzyme)5 minutes
Add 30 µl of AMPure/HighPrep beads to reaction and mix by flicking tube
Put directly on ice for at least 30 seconds

AB
1Barcoded and pooled DNA from previous step20 µl
2Barcode Adapter Mix II (AMII)5 μl
3Blunt/TA Ligase master mix25
4Total 50 µl

AB
1Barcoded and pooled DNA from previous step20 µl
2Barcode Adapter Mix II (AMII)5 μl
3Blunt/TA Ligase master mix25
4Total 50 µl

Prepare the following reaction
ABC
1Sequencing Buffer (SQB)37.5 µl 
2Loading Beads (LB)25.5 µl 
3DNA Library 12 µl 
4Total  75 µl

ABC
1Sequencing Buffer (SQB)37.5 µl 
2Loading Beads (LB)25.5 µl 
3DNA Library 12 µl 
4Total  75 µl

Pepare the following barcoding reaction.
AB
1Native barcode1 µl
2Blunt/TA Ligase master mix10 µl
3End-prepped DNA*9 µl
4Total20 µl

AB
1Native barcode1 µl
2Blunt/TA Ligase master mix10 µl
3End-prepped DNA*9 µl
4Total20 µl

Pool samples in equimolar concentration in DNA LoBind 1,5 ml Eppendorf tubes to get a total of 0.15 pmol.
Dilute pooled sample to 20 μl (or as much as needed if volume needed exceeds 20 µl) in Nuclease-free water.
Extract RNA using prefered method, spin column or magnetic beads.

Prepare the following reaction
AB
15x SuperScript IV buffer4 µl
2DTT (100 mM)1 µl
3Ribonuclease Inhibitor1 µl
4SuperScript IV Reverse Transcriptase1 µl
Mix and centrifuge, then add to the annealed RNA (13 µl)
Set up the following thermocycling settings
AB
123 °C10 min
255 °C15 min
380 °C10 min

AB
15x SuperScript IV buffer4 µl
2DTT (100 mM)1 µl
3Ribonuclease Inhibitor1 µl
4SuperScript IV Reverse Transcriptase1 µl

AB
123 °C10 min
255 °C15 min
380 °C10 min
Put directly on ice for at least 1 minute
Add 1 µl RNase H to each tube to degarde left over RNA

Primers designed using the Zibra project:
http://primal.zibraproject.org/
For PPRV we used an amplicon lenght of 800 bp and 100 bp overlap.
Prepare two primers pools (10µM), one with even numbered primer pairs and on with odd number primer pairs (
https://www.nature.com/articles/nprot.2017.066
)

Prepare the following reaction
AB
1Q5 reaction buffer (5x)5 µl
2dNTP mix (10 mM)0.5 µl
3Q5 DNA polymerase0.25 µl
4Primer pool 1 or 2 (10 µM)variable*
5DEPCUp to 22.5 µl
6Total22.5 µl
Add 2.5 µl of cDNA from step 4

AB
1Q5 reaction buffer (5x)5 µl
2dNTP mix (10 mM)0.5 µl
3Q5 DNA polymerase0.25 µl
4Primer pool 1 or 2 (10 µM)variable*
5DEPCUp to 22.5 µl
6Total22.5 µl

Set up the following thermocycling settings
ABC
1198 °C30 sec
22-4098 °C15 sec
32-4065 °C5 min

ABC
1198 °C30 sec
22-4098 °C15 sec
32-4065 °C5 min

Add AMPure/HighPrep magnetic beads to PCR reaction tube according to the following equation
Volume of beads per reaction = 1.8 x Reaction Volume
For example:
PCR reaction volume 50 µl + 90 µl AMPure beads

Mix the beads and PCR reaction thoroghly by pipetting up and down 10 times.
Incubate in RT for 3-5 minutes

Place tube in magnetic rack for 5-10 minutes to seperate beads
Aspirate the now clear solution from the reaction and discard

Add 200 µl newly prepared 70% ethanol to reaction tube when still on magnetic rack. Incubate for 30 sec at room temperature (RT).
Aspirate the etahnol and discard. Repeat wash once more.
Allow reaction tubes to air-dry in RT until completly dry and total evaporation of residual ethanol. 10-20 min

Add 40 µl of elution buffer (TE buffer, 10 mM Tris-Acetate pH 8.0, or reagent grade water) to each
reaction tube. Mix thoroghly by vortex or pipetting up and down.
Replace tube back to magnetic rack. When solution is cleared, remove and save for downstream reactions.

Dilute 0.12 pmol PCR products in nuclease free water to 25 µl
For our amplicons of 800 bp this means 60 ng of PCR product in 25 µl water.
To convert mass/moles:
https://nebiocalculator.neb.com/#!/dsdnaamt
Incubate on Hula mixer for 5 min at RT
Centrifuge tube and place on magnetic rack to pellet the magnetic beads. When solution is clear, pipet of supernatant and discard

While on magnatic rack, add 200 µl of freshly prepared 70 % ethanol to the tube.
Remove ethanol without disturbing the bead pellet. Repeat wash one more time.
Spin down beads and then place again on magnetic rack. Pipette of any residual ethanol. Allow to air dry for 3-5 min at RT

Remove tube from magnetic rack and resuspend pellet in 15 µl nuclease-free water and mix by flicking the tube.
Incubate for 2 min at RT.
Place tube on magnatic rack and allow beads to pellet.

Quantify 1 µl of end-prepped DNA using Qubit flourometer.
Recovery aim: 50-70 % of input
Thaw Native Barcodes at RT, individually mix by pipetting, and then place on ice.
Add 20 µl of AMPure/HighPrep beads to reaction and mix by flicking tube
Incubate on Hula mixer for 5 min at RT
Centrifuge tube and place on magnetic rack to pellet the magnetic beads. When solution is clear, pipet of supernatant and discard

While on magnatic rack, add 200 µl of freshly prepared 70 % ethanol to the tube.
Remove ethanol without disturbing the bead pellet. Repeat wash one more time.
Spin down beads and then place again on magnetic rack. Pipette of any residual ethanol. Allow to air dry for 3-5 min at RT

Remove tube from magnetic rack and resuspend pellet in 10 µl nuclease-free water and mix by flicking the tube.
Incubate for 2 min at RT.
Incubate for 10 min at RT

Mix the prepared library gently by pipetting up and down just before loading.
Add 75 µl of sample to the flow cell via the SpotON sample port dropwise, making sure that each drop flows into the port before adding the next.
Gently replace the SpotON sample port cover, close priming port and replace the MinION lid.

Add 20 µl of AMPure/HighPrep beads to reaction and mix by flicking tube.
If you needed to increase smaple volume in prevoius step, calculate 0.4X beads per reaction volume.
Centrifuge tube and place on magnetic rack to pellet the magnetic beads. When solution is clear, pipet of supernatant and discard

Add 250 µl of S Fragment Buffer (SFB). Flick the tube to resuspend beads, then return tube to magnetic rack to pellet the beads. Pipet of supernatant. Repeat this step once more. Make sure to get all of the SFB out. Spin down and pipet out again if needed.

Remove tube from magnetic rack and resuspend pellet in 15 µl nuclease-free water and mix by flicking the tube.
Incubate for 10 min at RT.
Place tube on magnatic rack and allow beads to pellet. Remove the now clear solution and add to new 1.5 ml DNA LoBind eppendorf tube. Store on ice.
Incubate on Hula mixer for 5 min at RT
Start sequence run

Quantify 1 µl of end-prepped DNA using Qubit flourometer.
Recovery aim: > 0.011 pmol /sample (equal to ~5.5 ng per sample for 800 bp amplicons).
Quantify 1 µl purified DNA using Qubit flourometer.
Thaw Sequencing Buffer (SQB), Loading Beads (LB), Flush Tether (FLT), and one tube of Flush Buffer (FLB) at RT, then place on ice as soon as thawed.
Take out flow cell. Open lid and slide the priming port cover clockwise to make the priming port visiable.

Check for small bubbles under the cover. Draw back a small volume of buffer to remove possible bubbles
(Set P1000 pipette to 200 µl, insert tip in port, turn until pipette set to 220-230 µl)
Load 800 µl of priming mix into flow cell via priming port, avoid introducing air. Wait for 5 minutes.

Prepare the flow cell priming mix.
Add 46 µl of thawed FLT directly to tube of thawed and mixed FLB. Mix by pipetting up and down.

Mix gently by flicking the tube, spin down.
Incubate the reaction at RT for 10 min.
Place tube on magnatic rack and allow beads to pellet.

Gently lift the SpotON sample port cover to make the SpotON sample port accessible.
Load 200 µl of priming mix into the flow cell via the priming port (not SpotOn port), do not introduce air.
Pool each sample, so both primer pools per sample are in the same tube

(Optional step to check PCR reaction)
Run 3-5 µl of sample on a 1 % agarose gel, 6-7 V/cm, 50-60 min.
Expected outcome: A clear band at amplicon size (e.g. 800 bp) and possibly a second band at x3 amplicon size (e.g. ~2400 bp)

materials.name: Q5 Hot Start High-Fidelity DNA Polymerase - 500 units
NEBNext Ultra II End Repair/dA-Tailing Module - 96 rxns

description: Peste-des-petit-ruminants virus is currently the focus of a control and eradication program launched by the FAO and OIE. One of the important steps in the control strategy is strengthening the laboratory capacity and improve molecular methods to characterize field isolates. This protocol describes the preparation of samples for sequencing using the MinION sequencer, from cDNA synthesis, PCR amplification using multiplex primers to loading off the sample on the flow cell. The miniPCR is used as the thermo cycler, making this protocol fully field-adapted and ready to use in the field or in a less well-equipped lab.
